info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 8:58PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cumberland, Prince Edward and northwestern Amelia Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 858 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hixburg, or 10 miles east of Appomattox, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Prospect around 910 PM EDT. Farmville and Hampden Sydney around 925 PM EDT. Longwood University and Guinea Mills around 930 PM EDT. Rice around 945 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Kingsville, Raines Tavern, Briery Creek Lake, Tuggle, Elam, Reeds, Angola, Stoddert, Allens Mill and McRae. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central Virginia.
